teacheasy.mediahandler.video

Class Video

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.video.Video

  • public class Video
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates a single video object on a page, including controls and media. Each audio object maintains its own state, and a list of the currently active audio objects is maintained by the audio handler.
    Version:
    1.1 10 Apr 2015
    Author:
    Alistair Jewers

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Video.ButtonEventHandler
      Handles performing actions on the video based on the buttons pressed by the user.
      class  Video.FullscreenKeyListener
      Listener for the esape key to exit fullscreen
      class  Video.MediaEndHandler
      Stops the media player when the it reaches the end of the current video.
      class  Video.MouseEventHandler
      Handles adding and removing the controls from the video when the mouse enters and leaves the frame.
      class  Video.PlayerStatusListener
      Listener for changes in the media player status.
      class  Video.ScanListener
      Handles moving through the video based on the user moving the scan bar.
      class  Video.ScanMouseHandler
      Handles enabling and disabling the scan bar.
      class  Video.VideoListener
      Listener for changes to the current position in the video to update the scan bar as the video plays.
      class  Video.VolumeListener
      Listener for the volume slider

    • Constructor Detail

      • Video

        public Video(javafx.scene.Group nGroup,
     float x,
     float y,
     float width,
     java.lang.String sourcefile,
     boolean autoPlay,
     boolean loop,
     javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> nFullScreenCloseHandler)
        Constructs the video and adds it to the group.
        Parameters:
        nGroup - The group this video goes on.
        x - The x coordinate of the top left of the video relative to the group's origin.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left of the video relative to the group's origin.
        width - The width of the video in pixels.
        sourcefile - Absolute path of the video as a string. Can be a local file path or a web address beginning with 'http'.
        autoPlay - If true the video plays immediately.
        loop - If true the video loops to the beginning when it ends.
